intro: Clidemia uribei, commonly known as the Uribé's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Puerto Rico and other nearby islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, often forming dense mats or low shrubs. Its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and are visited by various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Clidemia uribei plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and soil stability.
